com.nair.cache.common

Class CacheManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nair.cache.common.CacheManager

  • public final class CacheManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    vaishakh This is the Manager class for the Caching Solution. It abstracts the internal functionalities from the consumer of the APIs. It eagerly loads an instance of itself, which contains a Registry for all caches registered, and secondary data sources for those which have been supplied.

      • registerExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void registerExpirableCache(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                java.lang.Class<K> keyClass,
                                java.lang.Class<V> valueClass)
                            throws javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Used to register an Expirable Cache with the Registry
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        keyClass - the class which acts as the key
        valueClass - the value which acts as the value
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException - if an expirable cache with the same name has already been registered.

      • registerExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void registerExpirableCache(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                java.lang.Class<K> keyClass,
                                java.lang.Class<V> valueClass,
                                long timeOut,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
                            throws javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Used to register an Expirable Cache with the Registry
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        keyClass - the class which acts as the key
        valueClass - the value which acts as the value
        timeOut - the time out for the keys
        timeUnit - the Units in which above time out is calculated
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException - if an expirable cache with the same name has already been registered.

      • registerExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void registerExpirableCache(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                java.lang.Class<K> keyClass,
                                java.lang.Class<V> valueClass,
                                IExpirableCache<K,V> secondaryDataSource)
                            throws javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Used to register an Expirable Cache with the Registry
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        keyClass - the class which acts as the key
        valueClass - the value which acts as the value
        secondaryDataSource - The secondary data source from which data is to be fetched if value is not found in Cache. If value is found in secondary data source, then same will be populated to Cache, with timeout.
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException - if an expirable cache with the same name has already been registered.

      • registerExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void registerExpirableCache(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                java.lang.Class<K> keyClass,
                                java.lang.Class<V> valueClass,
                                long timeOut,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                IExpirableCache<K,V> secondaryDataSource)
                            throws javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Used to register an Expirable Cache with the Registry
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        keyClass - the class which acts as the key
        valueClass - the value which acts as the value
        timeOut - the time out for the keys
        timeUnit - the Units in which above time out is calculated
        secondaryDataSource - The secondary data source from which data is to be fetched if value is not found in Cache. If value is found in secondary data source, then same will be populated to Cache, with timeout.
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException - if an expirable cache with the same name has already been registered.

      • registerSecondaryDataSource

        private <K,V> void registerSecondaryDataSource(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                     IExpirableCache<K,V> secondaryDataSource)
        Used internally to register a Secondary Data Source
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        secondaryDataSource - The secondary data source from which data is to be fetched if value is not found in Cache. If value is found in secondary data source, then same will be populated to Cache, with timeout.

      • registerExpirableCache

        private <K,V> void registerExpirableCache(java.lang.String expirableCacheName,
                                ExpirableCache<K,V> expirableCache)
        Used internally to register an Expirable Cache
        Parameters:
        expirableCacheName - the name with which the expirable cache is to be registered
        expirableCache - the instance of the Expirable Cache

      • getValueFromExpirableCache

        public <K,V> V getValueFromExpirableCache(K k,
                                 java.lang.Class<V> clazz,
                                 java.lang.String registeredExpirableCache)
        Used to fetch a Value from the Expirable Cache. If Value is not found in Cache, and Secondary Data Source is configured for the cache, value is fetched from the same and populated in Cache.
        Parameters:
        k - the Key.
        clazz - The class in which response is expected
        registeredExpirableCache - The name with which the cache has been registered.
        Returns:
        The value that is present in the cache, or one that was loaded from Secondary Data Source(If configured)

      • putValueToExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void putValueToExpirableCache(K k,
                                  V v,
                                  java.lang.String registeredExpirableCache)
        Used to add a single Value to a Registered Expirable Cache
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        v - the value
        registeredExpirableCache - The name with which the cache has been registered.

      • putValueToExpirableCache

        public <K,V> void putValueToExpirableCache(K k,
                                  V v,
                                  long timeOut,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                  java.lang.String registeredExpirableCache)
        Used to add a single Value to a Registered Expirable Cache with specific timeout
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        v - the value
        timeOut - the timeout for the key
        timeUnit - the units in which timeout is calculated
        registeredExpirableCache - The name with which the cache has been registered.

                                      java.lang.String registeredExpirableCache)
        Used to populate a registered cache from an already existing Cache.
        Parameters:
        expirableCache - The existing cache
        registeredExpirableCache - The name with which the cache has been registered.
